reviews.text: My husband and I got married in the chapel and had our reception in Bailey. Not only was the event space amazing but the staff helped make our wedding perfect. They worked with me to create my dream wedding. We both had a place to get ready and hangout before the wedding. We reserved a wedding block and all of our family stayed on the mountain. It was nice to have everyone in a close space. We had breakfast for our family and friends in the dinning hall the morning after the wedding. Everyone loved getting to get back together for a meal before they left town. We also had the dinning hall cater our wedding. They made two wonderful types of pasta and served it for us in Bailey. They also made appetizers for guests to enjoy while we were taking pictures after our wedding. I would highly recommend this venue to anyone looking to get married in a beautiful part of Fayetteville and have everything in one place.
Very serene.  Not the 4 seasons in the lodging but very clean and quiet.
This is a terrible place. I lost my cat here
Lots of fun and it's so peaceful
Perfect quiet location to hold a weekend yoga retreat.

This place was really cool to see. I highly suggest anyone who is in the Fayetteville area to stop by. The young man on staff gave a great tour of the old house that the Clintons used to live in. Very cool to check out and they run on donations. They also have a cool little gift shop as well.
Don’t care for the politics but still a cool place to stop by and see. Our tour guide was great too!
Great museum! Rather small, but fascinating history. Very attentive staff to show you around.

There were many points of interest there. The First Ladies garden where Mrs. Clinton planted the favorite flowers of First Ladies was pleasant and educational, of course interesting that she would have planted it because her husband had not run for governor yet, much less president. The kitchen is in the colors she painted it, very 60s-70s hippie style. President Clinton's office was cool to see, back when he was a law professor. There is an interesting film of the Clintons to watch, and photos on the fridge of the two of them that are fun to see. Their bathroom is open to the public!
I don't know about it..

This place has been here forever. I live in Oklahoma but have eaten here many times over the years. They start you out with fresh homemade rolls and butter and honey. Then you order the chicken. As if their cast iron skillet fried chicken wasn't already the best they also have an option where they grill the fried chicken over hot coals for another layer of flavor. The only negative I can mention is that they have cut a couple of corners over the years like butter blend instead of pure butter and some of the sides are canned vegetables instead of fresh.

Seriously good cooking. Best catfish I know of. You won't starve on their side dishes either. This is the place I take my family when they come to town. Clean, great service, family friendly... And the best catfish I've ever found.

The food was great, second time we have gone in two weeks and both times it was excellent.  The onion rings are to die for, pretty much enough there for a whole meal (we take half home for later).  The chicken is great.  The bread doesn't come close to like a Colton's or Logan's but we didn't come for the bread.  The service has been excellent.  Inside is outdated, but that is what kind of makes the place to being with so don't expect new/fancy tables, etc.

The orignal carpet, out dated design, and old music... make this place unforgettable. The food is amazing and the atmosphere is phenomenal.  Sure the design is  "out dated" but i wouldn't change anything about this place. A truly down home, back at grandma's house vibe.
My first time was a good memory from 1971. Each time since has been great! They also serve our community in many kind ways.  Love AQ!

Such a wonderful dinner experience our group had!! We all sat on the patio and highly recommend how pretty it was. It's a dog friendly patio which we took advantage of!  The Irish Nachos, BBQ nachos and the ribs are some of the best items on the menu!

Wow, this place gets PACKED. Not all the time tho, nice and breezy at the moment. They have this killer game plan tho, you can smell the awesome food as soon as you open your car door right in the parking lot. Always clean, great Razorback decor, solid southern vibe. I’m not a huge BBQ guy but they run a nice looking business here.

I was looking for BBQ with variety and they have it. We opted to sit outside because it was pretty busy and we were pretty hungry. There were only two other tables and I felt a bit forgotten by our waitress. Other than that the food was good, fair price, atmosphere was nice, friendly staff. I'd recommend it.

We dined on sliced bbq beef and chopped pork. The beans were good, slaw was good. The meats are very tasty. The environment is nice. Seated right away at a hard top table in bar area which means your waitress is also the bartender. Service was a bit slow as pouring beer is a priority. I had the smoked chicken salad which was very good, I mean it's a salad but the smoked chicken was really good. Appetizer - cheese and sausage was good as well. Would rate this higher had the service been better.

Had the sliced brisket sandwich with okra and baked potato. Brisket was so good and the potato was huge. Lots of butter and the sauces are awesome. Our service was great. Definitely will be back! Thank you.

The steaks are good and the service was better than expected.  The fried dough balls with honey are good.  They have a large selection of over 150 beers to go with the steaks.  The location is easy to find with a large amount of parking.  The steaks should be ordered "medium".
This place is AWESOME!  Not cheap, but, well worth it.  Have enough leftovers for two more meals.  Steak cooked PERFECT!

Not very good service, took very long time for food.

Steaks were to be the big thing, yes they were big but lacking flavor and etc.

Salad was more of a morning created versus fresh.

Go other places in Bentonville for the same cost or better quality in a meal.

If you're looking for pounds of beef and nothing else then this is the spot to hit. Home style atmosphere with lackluster decor. Not alot of good steak choices on the menu. They focus on quantity of meat over the quality of meat. Beef is served as monster slabs which makes it hard for them to nail the temperature correctly. Not much choice for side dishes and the side salad is only lettuce without any options for dressing. We ordered several dishes and they all ended up being just a gut buster  Overall you're better off buying a nice quality steak from the grocery store and cooking it yourself.

Sat at the bar and had a petite filet (so much flavor and melted in our mouths!) with mushrooms and WOW is not a strong enough word to describe it. And we had the BEST dirty martini! You should go. Really. What are you waiting on?

Brunch brunch baby! Their Ole' spin on brunch is incredible! Wife and I devoured every last delicious bite of a B.L.A.T. bacon lettuce avocado tomato sandwich,  then wiped clean a plate of biscuits and chocolate gravy!

Jose's staff is super polite, the place was clean, and our whole visit was spectacular. Can't wait to return for more GREAT food and a couple frosty glasses of ice cold beer!

Great food, great service! Their blood orange margaritas are much better than their normal margarita. Their Steven Special is served with good “fajita style” chicken, not small chunks or shredded chicken like other places. Their steak fajitas are also served with great cuts of steak, and plenty of it! 

And they’ve got lots of nights with fun stuff going on! Follow them on Facebook to see what specials they have or what entertainment they might have for the night!

Credit card machine was down. Owner wanted my credit card number to enter later on. I was not comfortable with that for obvious reasons. She made me wait for 45 minutes while she tried to get a hold of her credit card system. Wife finally left to get cash while I had to wait in restaurant. Worst part was she didn't even try to make things right with us. She had a nonchalant attitude. Sad part was, the food was good. She just lost future be business over a $20 bill.
Great food at reasonable prices. Menu is diverse and consistent. If something isn’t right, they make it right. Now offering a brunch we will check out. Good people!

Brunch is awesome! It's great to have another breakfast option nearby. The green eggs and ham were great, and I had huevos rancheros today. Definitely a unique spin on morning meals, and the staff has been very friendly.
Great breakfast spot with a welcoming atmosphere! Student and family friendly with delicious, fairly priced, fresh baked goods. Will definitely be going here more often!
Quiche was so good. Breakfast sandwiches are hearty and pastry selection amazing! The coffee  was an extremely good surprise and will be back for sure!

I go there on the regular for the croissants. All three, almond, chocolate, and the original. I love how buttery they are and the fact that all the pastries are made from scratch. If you go on the weekend during the farmers market, definitely expect a little wait. But believe me, it will be worth it
Delicious! This place is good. I love thier quiche and you cannot best their prices. I cant wait til next time!
Cozy spot.  The food is fresh and local.  One of our favorite Fayetteville spots

Really good BBQ, large portions, fun atmosphere and attentive and friendly service. Probably the very best onion rings we've ever had. What more could you ask for, right? Well, a decent beer selection would be nice; they have Bud, Bud Light, Michelob, Miller Light. They do have Shiner Bock and Sam Adams so I do give them some credit - I personally don't care for either but at least it's a step up. How about a couple of local Arkansas breweries, one of which is 100 yards away?

Nice place for some BBQ in Fayetteville. They've got a unique way of ordering. There are little red phones at the booth that you pick up to call your order to the back. Pretty cute idea. 

The Pulled pork sandwiches are really great, and the BBQ sauces are both delicious. Unfortunately, the BBQ nachos were a little disappointing. Good flavor, but the chips were slightly stale. Potato salad was alright -- kind of your basic recipe. 

Service is slightly lacking. Everyone is friendly enough, but you'll wait a bit for someone to come back to fill your drinks and see if everything is alright. 

Price is about what you expect. No real amazing deals, but decent enough for a sit down meal.
First time here and love it! Great food, good prices, cold beer, laid back atmosphere. Fried pickles are top notch. I will be back to try everything on the menu!

Ribs were gross. Looked, felt, and tasted like they were cooked 3 days ago and just microwaved before they were plated. No way these were cooked in the last 24 hours. The potato salad was good, baked beans decent but I was expecting the ribs at a bar b q place to be at least decent. These were NOT. The other items seem to get good reviews. I would just recommend not getting the ribs.

I can't help but overeat when I come here.  It's a Fayetteville classic I'm really glad is still around.  I'm certainly not as fond of the other penguin eds locations.  I really love the smoked wings (best wing deal in town) and their pork loin and beef brisket are the best consistently.  They are eager to please, so you can substitute or change just about everything. They even have a small vegitarian menu which is nice.  You have to be careful turning in and leaving though as it's between the two curves of Archibald Yell.  My recommendation is to leave out the back way so you don't have to dodge cars you can't see coming up or down the hill. Well worth the drive if you want to com visit. I guarantee you will leave full and happy.

I ordered regular pulled pork plate and hubby got the while hog platter. They had run out of ribs, said that they could substitute more of the other two meats to make up for the ribs missing. I got more meat in my meal than hubby did. It appeared that they just left the ribs off, no substitutions provided. The food WAS good.

Decent BBQ, I would say overall, its not a bad place to stop in for a quick bite. They are generous in their portions and staff are always friendly. The sides here are pretty decent but the BBQ here is mediocre. Sorry to say that, there are just several other restaurants I would choose before going here for BBQ. This is a good place to stop in for lunch, they are fast and get your food to you quickly. The facilities could stand to be a little cleaner as well. Overall you wont have a bad experience here, you just won't have a memorable one.

Good BBQ, really good food if you haven't ate there give it a try u wont be disappointed. But the people behind the counter have no customer service at all I felt like we were a inconvenience for them. They need to work on that.

The ribs and chicken are good. The sliced beef tasted okay, but looked different than I guess I expected.
I wasn't please with the Cole slaw.
Clean restaurant and the service was good.

Im sitting in the booth now. Blue's on the radio. Ball game on the tv. Food taste like it smells, amazing. Yeah, this place has the look and feel of a BBQ joint, with the taste to back it up. Well done.
